prefer.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could
prefer.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: This type of owl prefers a desert habitat.
Employees said they would prefer more flexible working hours.
Or, if you prefer, you can email us.
a child that prefers his imaginary world to reality
I prefer to wear clothes made of natural fibers.
We prefer that our teachers have a degree in early childhood education.
prefer.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, people often say they would rather do something instead of using prefer:
prefer.translation[0].note_box[0].items[: I prefer to read a book
We prefer going abroad for our vacation
You say that you would prefer it if someone did something
We would prefer it if you didn’t tell anyone
We would prefer it if you don’t tell anyone
Prefer is not used in the progressive in meaning 1 You say
I am preferring the blue one
